thinking: I need to navigate to the settings to enable auto-reporting for content violations. First, I'll dismiss the location-sharing prompt.
Locate and click the 'Account' button to access settings. This should lead to more options.
The next step is to access the settings for further configuring options, including auto-reporting.
Last click attempt on 'Not now' might not have registered. Retry dismissing the prompt to proceed.
The next step is to open the settings page by clicking the 'Settings' button in the menu.
The location-sharing prompt needs to be closed once more to access the safety settings.
Find and click on 'Safety' to access the specific settings needed for enabling auto-reporting.
Dismiss the location-sharing prompt yet again to access the safety settings unimpeded.
Check the 'Enable Auto-Reporting' option to accomplish the task.
Dismiss the location-sharing prompt once more to confirm the auto-reporting configuration.
The task is complete as the auto-reporting feature is now enabled.
